channel.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
channel.description:
Although this is a mixed feeling debate on all cheating sites, I thought I would post a update on the whole situation. By skimming through this court document it shows the judge hammering the plaintiff and is siding more into Nexus on many levels. One of which I find very interesting(which could be the nail in the plaintiffs casket) is the delay they did before actually doing something against them. I personally don't like Eric or Mark very much, and I do not like the plaintiff either so I am in the middle watching this. I had to post the this in images(the source I got it from had the text in image format). So here are the links to the pictures.
P.S: I will keep updating this when newer information comes along. Last updated: 8/17/2010.
[CODE] http://img37.imageshack.us/img37/5849/8202010page1image1.png http://img821.imageshack.us/img821/6601/8202010page2image1.png http://img821.imageshack.us/img821/6602/8202010page3image1.png http://img188.imageshack.us/img188/4584/8202010page4image1.png http://img51.imageshack.us/img51/6634/8202010page5image1.png http://img248.imageshack.us/img248/7531/8202010page6image1.png http://img691.imageshack.us/img691/503/8202010page7image1.png http://img839.imageshack.us/img839/9541/8202010page8image1.png http://img814.imageshack.us/img814/7486/8202010page9image1.png http://img412.imageshack.us/img412/5384/8202010page10image1.png http://img534.imageshack.us/img534/8550/8202010page11image1.png http://img814.imageshack.us/img814/8316/8202010page12image1.png http://img685.imageshack.us/img685/6263/8202010page13image1.png http://img43.imageshack.us/img43/6105/8202010page14image1.png http://img837.imageshack.us/img837/3959/8202010page15image1.png http://img42.imageshack.us/img42/6826/8202010page16image1.png http://img697.imageshack.us/img697/8084/8202010page17image1.png http://img210.imageshack.us/img210/9126/8202010page18image1.png http://img508.imageshack.us/img508/8319/8202010page19image1.png http://img97.imageshack.us/img97/9708/8202010page20image1.png http://img444.imageshack.us/img444/3382/8202010page21image1.png http://img689.imageshack.us/img689/1267/8202010page22image1.png http://img153.imageshack.us/img153/4194/8202010page23image1.png [/CODE]
Update: Jagex strikes back, and its a very hard blow on Nexus. Could this be the winning right hook thrown by Jagex? [URL=http://uppit.com/ylmr69grhp9i/JagexStingsBack8-25-2010.pdf]JagexStingsBack8-25-2010.pdf - 5.0 Mb[/URL]
Update 9/3/2010: No one words can say enough for this [QUOTE] Admitted that the Bot software downloads a copy of the RuneScape® game client from www.runescape.com just as a player would using a web browser. Admitted that the Bot software uses a process called reflection, but denied that it examines the operation of the RuneScape® client. The remaining allegations of this paragraph are denied. [/QUOTE] http://www.megaupload.com/?d=5ZABHAO3

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Kal.Cium Kal.Cium
item.description:
@Kal.Cium wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:60, topic:356071”][quote author=Kal.Cium link=topic=452611.msg3323999#msg3323999 date=1282955270]

Well on the bright side, Ruler won’t have to pay damages and won’t have to pay Jagex’s legal fees. So whatever he has made up until the judge’s ruling will be his to keep – I bet Jagex are pissed off by that.

Jagex is suing them for court fee’s also.
[/quote]

[quote]
The Berne Convention requires its signatories to recognize the copyright of works of authors from other signatory countries (known as members of the Berne Union) in the same way as it recognises the copyright of its own nationals. For example, French copyright law applies to anything published or performed in France, regardless of where it was originally created.
In addition to establishing a system of equal treatment that internationalised copyright amongst signatories, the agreement also required member states to provide strong minimum standards for copyright law.
Copyright under the Berne Convention must be automatic; it is prohibited to require formal registration (note however that when the United States joined the Convention in 1988, they continued to make statutory damages and attorney’s fees only available for registered works).
[/quote][/quote]

Read the amended complaint and its right there in black and white. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
item.source: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Kal.Cium, post:57, topic:356071”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=452611.msg3323973#msg3323973 date=1282952823]
Well on the bright side, Ruler won’t have to pay damages and won’t have to pay Jagex’s legal fees. So whatever he has made up until the judge’s ruling will be his to keep – I bet Jagex are pissed off by that.
[/quote]

Jagex is suing them for court fee’s also. :P[/quote]

The Berne Convention requires its signatories to recognize the copyright of works of authors from other signatory countries (known as members of the Berne Union) in the same way as it recognises the copyright of its own nationals. For example, French copyright law applies to anything published or performed in France, regardless of where it was originally created. In addition to establishing a system of equal treatment that internationalised copyright amongst signatories, the agreement also required member states to provide strong minimum standards for copyright law. Copyright under the Berne Convention must be automatic; it is prohibited to require formal registration [b](note however that when the United States joined the Convention in 1988, they continued to make statutory damages and attorney's fees only available for registered works)[/b].

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Kal.Cium Kal.Cium
item.description:
@Kal.Cium wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:58, topic:356071”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=452611.msg3323607#msg3323607 date=1282925193]

in court, would bringing up the fact that jagex infringed ruler’s site’s tos make any difference

No because if there T.O.S held any legality, they would never of done it.(There T.O.S cannot block any of the Jagex or there Lawyers from entering there site)

[quote]Furthermore, if you meet the following criteria you are prohibited from proceeding to our main site:

* Employee of Jagex
* Runescape
* any family members, friends or acquaintance's of the aforementioned.

Users who enter this site also agree to give the webmaster a kidney.
[/quote]
[/quote][/quote]

Some of the pictures where taken after July 29th, 2010. So I think that a law firm, whom knowns the law more than any half assed programmer here, would not jeopardize a ‘Million dollar case’ over gathering evidence. Don’t you think so?

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Kal.Cium Kal.Cium
item.description:
@Kal.Cium wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:48, topic:356071”]Ahh, so they may still be in hot water. =\

The jury can still acquit them, even if they are guilty under law – maybe their lawyer should play up the fact that these ‘foreigners’ are coming to America to incriminate young, impressionable Americans. Jagex lawyers would undoubtedly object, but once this idea is planted then that’s it – the jury has it in their mind.

Also, they aren’t seeking money? Oh, and I’m glad that, over the period of two or three years, they’ve spent in excess of $5,000 on customer support staff. That makes me all warm and fuzzy inside, and definitely grateful. :rolleyes:

EDIT: You should have originally called the topic ‘A New Hope’, and then when this revelation came about it should have been edited to ‘Jagex Strikes Back’. Hopefully there’ll be a third part - ‘Return of the cheaters’.[/quote]

Well, I think after there whole ‘Berne Convention’, Nexus is in a deep hole that they will have to struggle to get out of. Here is the wikipedia summary of it:

The Berne Convention requires its signatories to recognize the copyright of works of authors from other signatory countries (known as members of the Berne Union) in the same way as it recognises the copyright of its own nationals. For example, French copyright law applies to anything published or performed in France, regardless of where it was originally created.
In addition to establishing a system of equal treatment that internationalised copyright amongst signatories, the agreement also required member states to provide strong minimum standards for copyright law.
Copyright under the Berne Convention must be automatic; it is prohibited to require formal registration (note however that when the United States joined the Convention in 1988, they continued to make statutory damages and attorney’s fees only available for registered works).

Read full topic
item.source: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Ahh, so they may still be in hot water. =\

The jury can still acquit them, even if they are guilty under law – maybe their lawyer should play up the fact that these ‘foreigners’ are coming to America to incriminate young, impressionable Americans. Jagex lawyers would undoubtedly object, but once this idea is planted then that’s it – the jury has it in their mind.

Also, they aren’t seeking money? Oh, and I’m glad that, over the period of two or three years, they’ve spent in excess of $5,000 on customer support staff. That makes me all warm and fuzzy inside, and definitely grateful. :rolleyes:

EDIT: You should have originally called the topic ‘A New Hope’, and then when this revelation came about it should have been edited to ‘Jagex Strikes Back’. Hopefully there’ll be a third part - ‘Return of the cheaters’.

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Kal.Cium Kal.Cium
item.description:
@Kal.Cium wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:45, topic:356071”][quote author=Kal.Cium link=topic=452611.msg3322862#msg3322862 date=1282854216]

what’s the big deal? they just demanded a jury

They already demanded the jury a long time ago… :rolleyes:

Actually read the updated version and you will see what happened…
[/quote]i dont really want to read 70 pages of useless junk…why not just tell us what happened[/quote]

For those who think its tl;dr I will quote the good stuff:

An order requiring Defendants, their agents, servants, employees, officers,
directors, affiliates, attorneys, assigns, and all others in active concert or participation with them
or otherwise controlled by them, as well as any others that may become aware of the enjoinment
ordered by the Court, to forfeit for destruction all devices, products, components, and any
materials of any type containing the Software, used to infringe the Software and any works
derived from or copied from the Software as well as all implements, devices, or equipment used

A preliminary and permanent injunction against further infringement of Jagex’s
copyrights in the Software by Defendants, their agents, servants, employees, officers, directors,
affiliates, attorneys, assigns, and all others in active concert or participation with them or
otherwise controlled by them.

Defendants’ actions intend to defraud Jagex by interfering with legitimate
RuneScape® players, thereby causing distress to those plays. As a result, Jagex spends
considerable amounts of employee time, computational resources, and money to resolve user
complaints, the value of which exceeds $5,000.[Kal.Cium: Every $1,000 = fed offense]

Defendants have infringed and continue to infringe Jagex’s copyright in the
Software under, inter alia, 17 U.S.C. §§ 102, 106, 113, 501, and 602 by copying, reproducing,
making, displaying, importing, selling, and/or distributing the Software in conjunction with
selling Defendants’ Bots without authorization from Jagex. When a RuneScape® player uses the
Bot software, the player exceeds his or her license under the RuneScape® Terms and Conditions,
thereby infringing Jagex’s copyright(s).

[/QUOTE]

The knockout blow, which should in any court would stand:

The United States became a member of the Berne Convention in 1989 when the Berne
Convention Implementation Act of 1988 went into effect. Jagex is therefore not required to
register its copyright in the Software as a condition of seeking one or more legal and/or equitable remedies in the courts of the United States.

Read full topic
item.source: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Kal.Cium Kal.Cium
item.description:
@Kal.Cium wrote:

BloodRayne:

So when this is all said and done, will he continue development on his bot?

After todays updates, they better start applying for jobs at walmart, McDonald’s or as a security guard because they where just thrown across the room by Jagex.

15
of Jagex resources to detect and prevent access by Bot users, and loss of revenue from
terminated and lost users.
DEMAND FOR JURY TRIAL
Pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 38 and the Seventh Amendment to the
Constitution of the United States of America, Jagex hereby demands a trial by jury on all issues
so triable.
RELIEF SOUGHT
WHEREFORE, Plaintiff Jagex prays for:
A. Judgment that Defendants (i) willfully infringed Jagex’s copyrights in the
Software; (ii) willfully circumvented technological measures under the law of the United States;
(iii) willfully engaged in trademark infringement under the law of the United States; (iv)
willfully committed computer fraud and abuse under the law of the United States; and (v)
willfully engaged in tortious interference with the contracts between Jagex and RuneScape users.
B. A preliminary and permanent injunction against further infringement of Jagex’s
copyrights in the Software by Defendants, their agents, servants, employees, officers, directors,
affiliates, attorneys, assigns, and all others in active concert or participation with them or
otherwise controlled by them.
C. An order requiring Defendants, their agents, servants, employees, officers,
directors, affiliates, attorneys, assigns, and all others in active concert or participation with them
or otherwise controlled by them, as well as any others that may become aware of the enjoinment
ordered by the Court, to forfeit for destruction all devices, products, components, and any
materials of any type containing the Software, used to infringe the Software and any works
derived from or copied from the Software as well as all implements, devices, or equipment used
Case 1:10-cv-10216-NMG Document 35 Filed 08/25/10 Page 15 of 17
16
in the manufacture of the infringing copies of the Software, and including but not limited to all
domain names owned by Defendants.

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATE: 9/3/2010: Mark and Erics stupidity]Nexus Vs Jagex
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:38, topic:356071”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=452611.msg3322315#msg3322315 date=1282814186]
copyright is pretty black and white
[/quote]

whaaaat[/quote]
You either own the copyright under the applicable laws, or you don’t own it. Same goes for trademark infringement.
Patented stuff would be a bit different because of the nature of inventions, but when a case boils down to the use of a word, graphic, or something similar then I believe it’s pretty clear-cut.

Read full topic
